page.title: List of encyclopedias by branch of knowledge

revisions.rev:
This is a list of [[encyclopedia]]s sorted by branch of knowledge. For other sorting criteria, see [[List of encyclopedias]]. ==General encyclopedia== ===Printed works=== ====English language==== *''[[The Children's Encyclopedia]]'', by [[Arthur Mee]]. *''[[Children's Illustrated Encyclopedia]]'', published by [[Dorling Kindersley]] *''[[Collier's Encyclopedia]]'' *''[[Columbia Encyclopedia]]'': a one-volume encyclopedia from [[Columbia University Press]] last published in 2000. *''[[Cambridge Encyclopedia]]'': a one-volume encyclopedia from [[Cambridge University Press]] last published in 1997 *''[[Compton's Encyclopedia]]'': 26 volume encyclopedia *''[[Encyclopedia Americana]]'': both a print work and currently a part of Grolier Multimedia Encyclopedia. *''[[EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica]]'': one of the best-known encyclopedias in English. See also the ''[[1911 EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica]]''. *''[[Funk & Wagnalls]]'' *''[[Groliers Encyclopedia]]'' *''[[Grolier Book of Knowledge]]'': 20 volumes of equal length *''[[New American Desk Encyclopedia]]'': Small paperback encyclopedia last published in 1997 *''[[Oracle EncyclopÃ¦dia]]'': a five volume encyclopedia published in 1895 *''[[Random House Encyclopedia]]'': a one-volume encyclopedia from [[Random House]] last published in 1990 *''[[Pears Cyclopaedia]]'': a one-volume encyclopaedia published annually in the United Kingdom *''[[The Penguin Encyclopedia]]'': a one-volume encyclopedia published by the [[Penguin Group]] in 2002 and edited by [[David Crystal]] *''[[World Book Encyclopedia]]'': designed for family use, World Book is the world's best selling print encyclopedia
====Spanish language==== *''[[Diccionario EnciclopÃ©dico Espasa]]'' *''[[Diccionario EnciclopÃ©dico Hispano-Americano de Literatura, Ciencias y Artes]]'': Barcelona, Montaner y SimÃ³n, 1887â1899, reprints and appendices up to 1910. Reprinted by the London editor Walter M. Jackson (C. H. Simonds Company, Impresores, Boston, Estados Unidos de Norte AmÃ©rica). *''[[Enciclopedia Encarta]]'' *''[[Enciclopedia Espasa|Enciclopedia universal ilustrada europeo-americana]]''; the biggest encyclopedia of its time. Also known as Enciclopedia Espasa o Enciclopedia Espasa-Calpe *''[[Enciclopedia Labor]]'' *''[[Enciclopedia Libre|Enciclopedia Libre Universal]]'' also known as ''Enciclopedia Libre'' *''[[Enciclopedia moderna: diccionario universal de literatura, ciencias, artes, agricultura, industria y comercio]]'', Madrid: editor Francisco de Paula Mellado, 1851-1855, 37 volÃºmenes. *''[[Enciclopedia Salvat]]'' *''[[Gran enciclopedia planeta]]'', 20 volumes, DVD and on-line encyclopedia, 2004. Geared for adults, and published by the same people who publish the EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica. *''Britannica Enciclopedia Universal Ilustrada'', 20 volumes; heavily illustrated. Also published by the EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica, but designed for students 10â17 years of age. *''[[Nueva enciclopedia Durvan]]'' *''[[Nueva enciclopedia cumbre]]'', published by Grolier in 14 volumes and available online.
====Other languages==== *''[[Allgemeine EncyclopÃ¤die der Wissenschaften und KÃ¼nste]]'': very large 19th-century German-language encyclopaedia by Ersch and Gruber *''[[Anabritannica]]'': published in [[Turkey]] and based on the ''Britannica [[MicropÃ¦dia]]'' *''[[Banglapedia]]'': National encyclopedia of [[Bangladesh]] *''[[Brockhaus encyclopedia|Brockhaus]]'': German encyclopedia *''[[Brockhaus and Efron Encyclopedic Dictionary|Brockhaus and Efron]]'': Russian-language imperial encyclopedia in 86 volumes *[[Encyclopedia of China]] *''[[Den Store Danske EncyklopÃ¦di]]'' (The Great Danish Encyclopedia) in Danish *''[[Enciclopedia Italiana]]'' in Italian *''[[Enciklopedija Jugoslavije]]'' in Serbo-Croatian *''[[Enciklopedija Slovenije]]'' in Slovene *''[[Enciclopedia RomÃ¢niei]]'' in Romanian (1939) *''[[Great Soviet Encyclopedia]]'' (''ÐÐ¾Ð»ÑÑÐ°Ñ Ð¡Ð¾Ð²ÐµÑÑÐºÐ°Ñ Ð­Ð½ÑÐ¸ÐºÐ»Ð¾Ð¿ÐµÐ´Ð¸Ñ''): The second largest and most comprehensive encyclopedia in Russian; here were 3 editions, 3rd edition of 1969-1978 contains 30 volumes *''[[Grosses vollstÃ¤ndiges Universal-Lexicon]]'': huge 18th-century German encyclopedia by [[Johann Heinrich Zedler]] *''[[Gujin tushu jicheng]]'': Chinese language encyclopedia completed in 1725 (10 million Chinese characters) *''[[Tamil Kalaik kaLanjiyam]]'': Tamil-language 10-volume encyclopedia published in 1963. *''[[Lexicon Universale]]'' in Latin (1698) *''[[Magyar Nagylexikon]]'' (The Great Hungarian Lexicon): 19 volume general encyclopedia in Hungarian *''[[Musik in Geschichte und Gegenwart]] (1999): 27 volume German encyclopedia of music and musicians *''[[Meyers Konversations-Lexikon]]''; in German *''[[Pomorska enciklopedija]]'': in Serbo-Croatian (The Maritime Encyclopedia) *''[[Medicinska enciklopedija]]'': in Serbo-Croatian *''[[TehniÄka enciklopedija]]'': in Serbo-Croatian (Technical encyclopedia) *''[[Enciklopedija hrvatske umjetnosti]]'': in Croatian (The Encyclopedia of Croatian Art), (2005) *''[[Filmska enciklopedija]]'': in Croatian (The Film encyclopedia) *''[[Nationalencyklopedin]]'': encyclopedia in Swedish *''[[Nordisk familjebok]]'': encyclopedia in Swedish *''[[Otto's encyclopedia]]'': the largest Czech-language encyclopedia published between 1888â1908 and 1930â1943 *''[[The Book of Healing]]'': a thirty volume Arabic-language encyclopedia published by [[Avicenna]] in 1027 *''[[The Persian Encyclopedia]]'' : a three volume Persian-language encyclopedia edited by [[Gholamhossein Mosahab]], partially based on the early editions of the [[Columbia Encyclopedia]] *''[[Vojna enciklopedija]]'' in Serbo-Croatian (The Military Encyclopedia) *''[[Wielka Encyklopedia Powszechna PWN]]'', 13 volumes, 1962â1970, the largest encyclopedia to date in Polish *''[[Wielka Encyklopedia PWN]]'', 2001â2005, the successor to the WEP PWN; larger and more objective, it is currently being finished
===On CD-ROM, DVD-ROM and/or the Internet=== *[http://reference.allrefer.com/encyclopedia/ AllRefer.com: Columbia Encyclopedia] *[[Compton's Interactive Encyclopedia]]: only available in electronic form. *[[EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica]]. See also the ''[[1911 EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica]]''. *[[EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica Ultimate Reference Suite]], available on DVD *[http://www.megabook.ru Encyclopedia of Kirill and Mefodiy]: in Russian. *[[Gran Enciclopedia Planeta]], in Spanish. *[[Grolier's Electronic Encyclopedia]]: The first computer encyclopedia, produced on CD-ROM by KnowledgeSet in 1985. *[[Encarta|Microsoft Encarta]]: once published by [[Microsoft]], now discontinued. It was only available in electronic form. *[[Nueva enciclopedia cumbre]], published by Grolier. *[[Micronet Universal]]: in Spanish. Published by Micronet. * [http://www.encyclopedie-larousse.fr/ here [[EncyclopÃ©die Larousse en ligne]], available]. * [http://www.babylon.com/display.php?id=961&tree=5&level=3 here ''[[The Enciclopedia Compacta Britannica]]'', available from Babylon]. The ''Britannica Concise Encyclopedia'' translated into Spanish. *[http://www.rubricon.com Rubricon]: the largest online encyclopedic portal in Russian. *[[Wikipedia]]: Officially the world's largest free encyclopedia â a project to create a comprehensive encyclopedia using [[wiki]] software * [http://www.mackiev.com/world_book.html Software MacKiev [[World Book]]: Windows and Mac electronic versions published by]. Contains every article from print encyclopedia.
==== Website only ====
* [[Enciclopedia Libre]]: project to create a Spanish encyclopedia using [[wiki]] software, released under the [[GNU Free Documentation License|GFDL]]. * [[Encyclopedia of Life Sciences]] * ''Encyclopaedia of Turkey'': An online encyclopedia about Turkey and Anatolian Culture. * [http://enciclopediaromaniei.ro website [[Enciclopedia RomÃ¢niei]] (Encyclopedia of Romania): project to create a Romanian-language encyclopedia using [[wiki]] software, released under the [[Creative Commons licensese|CC by-nc-nd 3.0]] -] * ''EncycloZine'': an online encyclopedia of books and knowledge. * [[Everything2]] * [[Grolier Multimedia Encyclopedia]]: an electronic encyclopedia published by [[Grolier]]. * [[Hierarchypedia|''Hierarchypedia'': an online encyclopedia using Wikimedia that is no longer online.]] * [http://www.faqs.org/ Internet FAQ archives] * ''netcyclo'': John Anderson's Internet encyclopedia project. * [[Nupedia]]: a [[peer review]]ed, [[open content]] encyclopedia project, currently inactive. * [[Open Site]]: an effort inspired by, but not officially affiliated with, the [[Open Directory Project]]. * [[EkÅi SÃ¶zlÃ¼k]]: a collaborative hypertext Turkish dictionary and encyclopedia site that shares a similar concept with Everything2 or H2G2. * [[Probert Encyclopaedia]]: an online topical encyclopedia consisting of almost 100,000 short entries, published by Mathew Probert and based in the United Kingdom. * [[Susning.nu]]: project to create a Swedish-language encyclopedia using [[wiki]] software. Anyone-can-edit encyclopedia until 2004, shut down in 2009. * [[Wikipedia]] *''Wikiweise'': project to create a German-language encyclopedia using wiki software, released under the [[GNU Free Documentation License|GFDL]]. * [[WikiZnanie]]: project to create a Russian-language encyclopedia using wiki software, released under the [[FreeBSD Documentation License|BSD DPL]].

====Canadian==== *''[[Canada: An Encyclopedia of the Country]]'' - (1898â1900) *''[[Canada and its Province]]'' - (1913â1917) *''[[The Canadian Encyclopedia]]'' - (1985 and 1988) *''[[Encyclopedia Canadiana]]'' - (1957) *''[[The Encyclopedia of Canada]]'' - (1935â1937) *''[[Encyclopedia of Music in Canada]]'' - (1981 and 1992) *''[[The Junior Encyclopedia of Canada]]'' - (1989)

====Iranian==== *''[[Dehkhoda Dictionary|Loghatnameh Dehkhoda]]'': a fourteen volume [[Persian language|Persian]] dictionary edited by [[Dehkhoda|Dr. Ali Akbar Dehkhoda]] *''[[EncyclopÃ¦dia Iranica]]'': on [[Iranian peoples]] and [[Iran]] (Persia) *''[[Encyclopaedia of Iran and Islam]]'' published in [[Persian language|Persian]] in [[Tehran]] *''[[Encyclopaedia of Persian Language and Literature]]'' published by the [[Academy of Persian Language and Literature]] in [[Persian language|Persian]] in [[Tehran]] *''[[The Encyclopedia of Iranian Old Music]]'': Published in Tehran, 2000.
====London==== * ''[[The London Encyclopaedia]]'' 1007 page reference of the city of London, pub. 1983
====Malaysian==== * ''[[The Encyclopedia of Malaysia]]'', published from 1998 to 2007
====New Zealand==== * ''[[The Cyclopedia of New Zealand]]'' (1897â1908) unofficial, most subjects paid to have their articles appear, online at the [[New Zealand Electronic Text Centre]]. * ''[[An Encyclopaedia of New Zealand]]'' (1966) official. * ''[[Te Ara Encyclopedia of New Zealand]]'' (2005â) official, incorporating the full text of ''An Encyclopaedia of New Zealand''.
====Pakistan==== * ''[[Encyclopedia of Pakistan]]'', published in 2006 by Oxford University Press

===Subject=== ====Art and Architecture==== *''Wasmuths Lexikon der Baukunst'', ed. by GÃ¼nther Wasmuth, Berlin: Wasmuth, 1929-1937, 5 vls. * ''[[Grove Dictionary of Art]]'' in 34-volumes (1996) *''Encyclopedia of 20th-century architecture'', ed. by R. ====Entertainment==== * ''[[Allgame]]'': A comprehensive online guide to [[Video game|computer and video games]] created by [[All Media Guide]]. * ''[[Allmovie]]'': A comprehensive online guide to [[movies]] created by [[All Media Guide]]. * ''[[Allmusic]]'': A comprehensive online guide to music created by [[All Media Guide]]. * ''[[Quasimodobell]]'': Online Encyclopedia for music artists & bands
====Environmental Science==== *''[[Encyclopedia of Hydrological Science]]'' John Wiley and Sons [www.wiley.co.uk/ehs] *''[[Encyclopedia of Earth]]'' (''EoE'') (an electronic reference about the Earth, its natural environments, and their interaction with society) *''[[Encyclopedia of Life Support Systems]]'' (EOLSS) -- sponsored by UNESCOâan interdisciplinary encyclopedia, inspired by the sustainable development movement *''[[Ekopedia]]'' -- a [[wiki]] [[encyclopedia]] about [[environmental sustainability]]
====Fashion and dress==== * ''Encyclopedia of Clothing and Fashion'', ed. by [[Valerie Steele]], 3 vls., Detroit [etc.]: Thomson Gale, 2005 *''Berg Encyclopedia of World Dress and Fashion'', ed. by Joanne B. Eicher, 10 vls., Oxford [etc.] : Berg, 2010 (also online)
====Fiction (or fictional)==== * [[List of animals (Borges)|Celestial Emporium of Benevolent Knowledge]], a fictional Chinese encyclopedia invented by [[Jorge Luis Borges]] * [[Encyclopedia Galactica]] was created and referenced by [[Isaac Asimov]]'s [[Foundation (book)|Foundation]] [[The Foundation Series|series]]. * [[The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy]] pays homage to the Encyclopedia Galactica, but is apparently better because it is slightly cheaper and has the words "Don't Panic" written on the cover. * ''[[The Rocklopedia Fakebandica]]'' by T. Mike Childs, pub. 2004 * ''[[The Star Trek Encyclopedia]]''

First Edition, 1940. Sixth Edition, 2001. * ''[[Encyklopedia Polski]]'' (Encyclopedia of Poland). *''[[Harper's Encyclopedia of United States History]] From 458 to 1905'': Harper & Brothers *''Encyclopedia of U.S. labor and working-class history'', ed. by Eric Arnesen, New York, New York [etc.] : Routledge, 2007 * [http://hls-dhs-dss.ch ''[[Historical Dictionary of Switzerland]]''], historical encyclopedia of Switzerland in German, French and Italian, (Print edition: 2002-). * [http://www.historisches-lexikon-bayerns.de Historisches Lexikon Bayerns] multimedia online encyclopedia of Bavarian history. * ''[[The Kingfisher History Encyclopedia]]'' *''The International Encyclopedia of Revolution and Protest: 1500 to the Present'', ed. by Immanuel Ness, Malden, Massachusetts [etc.]: Wiley & Sons, 2009, ISBN 1-4051-8464-7 * ''[[Lexikon des Mittelalters]]'' (German encyclopedia of medieval history; 1980ff.) * ''[[Oxford Classical Dictionary]]'': Despite the name, a one-volume encyclopedia for antiquity. * ''RealencyclopÃ¤die der classischen Altertumswissenschaft'': [[Pauly-Wissowa]] (Eds.) (1894â1980; specialising in classical antiquity). * ''World War II Encyclopedia'' (Time-Life Publications, 1976) *''[[Encyclopedia Rizaliana]]'': a one-volume encyclopedia about the life, works and influence of the Philippine patriot, Jose Protasio Rizal, published by [[Lulu (publisher)|Lulu Press]] in 2008 and edited by [[Jose Fadul]]
====Language==== *[[Historisches WÃ¶rterbuch der Rhetorik]] *''Encyclopedia of language & linguistics'', ed. by Keith Brown, 14 vls., Amsterdam [etc.] : Elsevier, 2nd edition 2006 *''The international encyclopedia of communication'', 12 vls., Malden, Mass. [etc.] : Blackwell, 2008

====Medicine==== {{For|further examples|:Category:Encyclopedias on medicine}} * ''[[Medicalopaedia]]'' encyclopaedia of [[medicine]] by [[Burhan Ahmed]] * ''[[Al-Tasrif|Kitab al-Tasrif]]'' (''The Method of Medicine''), by [[Abu al-Qasim al-Zahrawi]] (Abulcasis) * ''[[American Medical Association Complete Medical Encyclopedia]]'' * ''[[Ayurvedic Encyclopedia]]'',<ref>[http://www.ayushveda.com]</ref> * ''[[The Canon of Medicine]]'', by [[Avicenna]] * ''Cerrahiyyetu'l-Haniyye'' (''Imperial Surgery''), by [[Åerafeddin SabuncuoÄlu]] * ''The Comprehensive Book on Medicine'', by [[Ibn al-Nafis]] * ''[[Encyclopedia of Natural Medicine]]'' * ''[[Encyclopedia of Public Health]]'' * ''Firdous al-Hikmah'' (''Paradise of Wisdom''), by [[Ali ibn Sahl Rabban al-Tabari]] * ''[[Medical Compendium in Seven Books]]'' by [[Paul of Aegina]] in the 7th century CE; it was the most complete medical encyclopedia in its day * ''[[Taber's Cyclopedic Medical Dictionary]]''
====Music==== * ''[[Enciclopedia della musica]]'', 2001â2005, edited by Jean-Jacques Nattiez, in 5 volumes. The first goal is to create a [[database]] similar to [[CDDB]]. * [http://www.nazarian.no/def.asp?lang=0&page_id=1 Nazarian`s Gun`s Recognition Guide] * ''[[The Oxford Companion to Wine]]'' * ''[[Perelman's Pocket Cyclopedia of Cigars]]'' An encyclopedia and history of (Non-Cuban) cigars and their manufacturers (also ''[[Perelman's Pocket Cyclopedia of Cigars|Perelman's Pocket Cyclopaedia of Havana Cigars]]'') * ''[[The Sotheby's Wine Encyclopedia]]'' * ''[[The Woman's Encyclopedia of Myths and Secrets]]'' * ''De Encyclopedie'' (''The Encyclopedia''), parody encyclopedia by Dutch author [[Hugo Brandt Corstius|Battus]] * ''[http://www.watch-wiki.com Watch Wiki]'', encyclopedia about mechanical watches *''[[Encyclopedia of Associations]]'': a printed directory of associations and nonprofit groups published by [[Thomson Gale]].
